papers.title:
The Stanford NLP Group makes some of our
    Natural Language Processing software
    available to everyone!  We provide statistical NLP,
    deep learning NLP, and rule-based NLP tools for
    major computational linguistics problems, which can be
    incorporated into applications with human language technology needs.
    These packages are widely used in industry, academia, and government.
papers.overview: The Stanford NLP Group makes some of our Natural Language Processing software available to everyone! We provide statistical NLP, deep learning NLP, and rule-based NLP tools for major computational linguistics problems, which can be incorporated into applications with human language technology needs.

papers.title:
This code is actively being developed, and we try to answer questions and
	fix bugs on a best-effort basis.
papers.overview: This code is actively being developed, and we try to answer questions and fix bugs on a best-effort basis.

papers.title:
GNU
        General Public License
papers.overview: These software distributions are open source, licensed under the GNU General Public License (v3 or later for Stanford CoreNLP; v2 or later for the other releases). Note that this is the full GPL, which allows many free uses, but does not allow its incorporation (even in part or in translation) into any type of proprietary software which you distribute.

papers.title:
A key mission of the Natural Language Processing Group is
          graduate and undergraduate education in all areas of Human
          Language Technology including its applications, history, and social context.
papers.overview: A key mission of the Natural Language Processing Group is graduate and undergraduate education in all areas of Human Language Technology including its applications, history, and social context.

papers.title:
Stanford University offers a rich assortment of courses in
          Natural Language Processing and related areas, including 
          foundational courses as well as advanced seminars.

papers.title:
The Stanford NLP Group is always on the lookout for budding new
      computational linguists.  Stanford has a great program at the
      cutting edge of modern computational linguistics.
papers.overview: The Stanford NLP Group is always on the lookout for budding new computational linguists. Stanford has a great program at the cutting edge of modern computational linguistics.

papers.title:
If you have questions about admissions, please check the
      graduate admissions web pages listed on the right, or write to
      the admissions email addresses listed.  We NLP Group members
      attempt to answer specific NLP-related admissions questions
      (although sometimes we get too busy...), but in general it isn't
      necessary or helpful to contact us to let us know that you want to
      apply or have applied for admission.
papers.overview: If you have questions about admissions, please check the graduate admissions web pages listed on the right, or write to the admissions email addresses listed. We NLP Group members attempt to answer specific NLP-related admissions questions (although sometimes we get too busy...), but in general it isn't necessary or helpful to contact us to let us know that you want to apply or have applied for admission.

papers.title: Computer Science Department
papers.overview: I am an assistant professor in the Computer Science Department at Stanford , affiliated with the Stanford NLP Group , Stanford HCI Group , Stanford AI Lab (SAIL) , and Stanford Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI) . I am interested in Socially Aware NLP , Large Language Models (LLMs) and Human-AI Interaction , with a focus on how LLMs can augment human capabilities across research, work and well-being.

papers.title: My work focuses on machine learning and natural language processing. My research interests lie in developing better models for (grounded, multi-agent, retrieval-augmented) language understanding and better tools for evaluation and benchmarking.
papers.overview: My work focuses on machine learning and natural language processing. My research interests lie in developing better models for (grounded, multi-agent, retrieval-augmented) language understanding and better tools for evaluation and benchmarking.

papers.title: Practitioner Voices Summit
papers.overview: Our Practitioner Voices Summit in June hosted 60 teachers from 22 states, to provide them with a platform to inform R&D related to AI in classrooms. The rooms were buzzing with energy with all the ideas, and the dedication of these teachers to their students.

papers.title: The first name is pronounced as Tung-√º, where √º is roughly a mixture of i and u, as in German. I'm more than happy to accept any approximation, so please feel free to use your favorite variants/surrogates!

papers.title: Hi! I am an assistant professor of computer science at Stanford. My research interests broadly include topics in machine learning, algorithms and their theory, such as deep learning, (deep) reinforcement learning, pre-training / foundation models, robustness, non-convex optimization, distributed optimization, and high-dimensional statistics.
papers.overview: Hi! I am an assistant professor of computer science at Stanford.

papers.title: Legible: Levanter comes with a new named tensor library named Haliax that makes it easy to write legible, composable deep learning code, while still being high performance.
papers.overview: Legible : Levanter comes with a new named tensor library named Haliax that makes it easy to write legible, composable deep learning code, while still being high performance.

papers.title: Scalable: Levanter is designed to scale to large models, and to be able to train on a variety of hardware, including GPUs and TPUs.
papers.overview: Scalable : Levanter is designed to scale to large models, and to be able to train on a variety of hardware, including GPUs and TPUs.

papers.title: Reproducible: Levanter is bitwise deterministic, meaning that the same configuration will always produce the same results, even in the face of preemption and resumption.
papers.overview: Reproducible : Levanter is bitwise deterministic, meaning that the same configuration will always produce the same results, even in the face of preemption and resumption.

papers.title: Analyzing the benefits and risks of foundation models with widely available weights
papers.overview: Analyzing the benefits and risks of foundation models with widely available weights

papers.title: Paper (ICML 2024 Oral)
papers.overview: Paper (ICML 2024 Oral) Blog Policy brief Authors

papers.title:
Identifying distinctive properties.Foundation models released with widely available
                        weights have
                        distinctive properties that lead to both their benefits and risks. We outline five
                        properties
                        that inform our analysis of their societal impact: broader access, greater customizability, the
                        ability for local inference and adaptability, an inability to rescind model weights once
                        released, and an inability to monitor or moderate usage.
papers.overview: Identifying distinctive properties. Foundation models released with widely available weights have distinctive properties that lead to both their benefits and risks.
